conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time graph to determine if the particle has returned to its starting point at the 3-second mark.
The graph shows a particle moving in a straight line.
The particle starts at a velocity of 2 m/s.
The particle experiences a constant velocity of 0 m/s for 1 second.
The particle changes its direction and moves with a constant negative velocity of -2 m/s for 2 seconds.
The particle moves with a constant positive velocity of 2 m/s for 1 second.
At 0 seconds, the particle is at a position of 0 m.
At 1 second, the particle is at a position of 2 m.
At 2 seconds, the particle is at a position of 0 m.
At 3 seconds, the particle is at a position of 2 m.
Since the particle's final position (2 m) is not at the starting position (0 m), the particle has not returned to its starting point at the 3-second mark.
Final Answer: No, the particle has not returned to its starting point at the 3-second mark.
